title: Calories in Uranium
meta_description: Discover calories in uranium (zero, as it's not food), plus full nutrition breakdown, warnings, and why it's dangerous to even consider.
assumptions: Pure metallic uranium; not a consumable food item; hypothetical analysis only.
disclaimer: Uranium is highly radioactive and toxic; ingestion causes severe radiation poisoning and death. This is not nutritional advice—do not consume. Values are zero due to no caloric content.

quick_answer.text: Uranium contains 0 calories and provides no nutrition; it's extremely hazardous.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison, though uranium has none.

faqs.a: Zero calories—uranium is a metal element, not food.
No, it's radioactive and toxic; provides no nutrition and causes fatal poisoning.

faqs.q: Why does uranium have no calories?
faqs.a: Calories measure energy from food macronutrients; uranium contains none.

faqs.q: What happens if you eat uranium?
faqs.a: Immediate health risks include radiation exposure, organ damage, and death—seek medical help if exposed.

faqs.q: Can uranium be used in food somehow?
faqs.a: Absolutely not; it's used in nuclear applications, not diet. Consult experts for safe materials.
